data.title: General Discussion: Hollywood tycoon (old Big Fish games game)
data.text:
Hi,

I've been trying to run Hollywood Tycoon (an old game from Big Fish games) in a window using the tool, but every time the game window appears and disappears. I tried taking logs with the setting recommended in the help files, but the log file always comes out empty.

Is there anything I could try that may help run the game?

Ok, let me say (again) that Big Fish games are, despite the apparent simplicity, a hellish task to tame because they have very strong protection schemas. I downloaded the time-limited 1 hour demo and got some success, but in 1 hour I won't be able to help any more.

Because of the protections the game needs early hook and hot patching, definitely the strongest set of hooking tools. I would also add to DxWnd.exe administrator capabilities, just in case.

The attached export should work as it is, since the game installer doesn't let you pick a different game folder, in any case you can check and update the path if necessary.

Enjoy.

Thank you very much for the help. I have the official copy from Big Fish so unfortunately can't help with where else to get it from. However with your solution I still only make it the intial loading screen before it crashes. Still appreciate the effort a lot.

In the attempt to recover the game I got a CD image from Internet Archive, it is "Hollywood Tycoon" by Astragon, 2005, but the game doesn't resemble at all the one with the screenshots here. It works, but I believe it is another game.
